Item.name: Johnny Knocker's Blackout Label
Item.description: After the days of the archiac truncheon, yet before the infamous stun baton, came the humble Tonfa. It strikes a fine line between splitting skulls and seeing stars, but it needs all of one's strength to do so.

Item.name: Tonfa
Item.description: After the days of the archiac truncheon, yet before the infamous stun baton, came the humble Tonfa. It strikes a fine line between splitting skulls and seeing stars, but it needs all of one's strength to do so.

Item.name: Truncheon
Item.description: A simple, heavy club with a hard iron core and head. At one point in time, this was considered a less-than-lethal weapon. Nowadays, people just kind of accept it for the skull-splitter that it is.

Item.name: Cutlass
Item.description: A classic swept, broad-bladed sword with a fist guard, in vogue among the Coalition's upper echelons of command.

Item.name: Katana
Item.description: A razor sharp, deceptively light long sword with a curved blade, popular among Seperatists, for whatever reason.

Item.name: Sledgehammer
Item.description: A heavy hammer head on a long stick, making for a hell of a weighty tool, which does just as well at demolishing walls as it does skulls.

Item.name: Shock Sledge
Item.description: A heavy hammer head on a long stick, making for a hell of a weighty tool, which does just as well at demolishing walls as it does skulls. Augmented with a shorter handle and capacitor discharge system, it packs a little less blunt force oomph, but is still plenty capable of cracking skulls and laying out all but the largest creatures with electric voltage.

Item.name: Fireax
Item.description: A heavy, hardened steel axe head on a sturdy handle with a prying hook. Very useful for breaching hulls and doors in emergency situations, though it's bulk and heavy head make it less utilitous, though still viable, as a weapon.

Item.name: Pickaxe
Item.description: A heavy, hardened steel sharp pick head on a sturdy handle. Akin to a spiked sledgehammer, it delivers extremely heavy impacts, designed for breaking up clumps of hardened ore, though it works just as well against softer, fleshier targets.

Item.name: Escoba
Item.description: A classic weapon of ass destruction, oft employed by angry aunties on Europa and Terra alike.

Item.name: Flamberge
Item.description: A huge, wavy-bladed greatsword of impeccable quality. Something like this is almost entirely ceremonial and very difficult to swing around in the confines of a submarine, but can chop a man in half nonetheless.

Item.name: Greatsword
Item.description: A huge, two-handed sword. Likely forged by some mechanic with spare welding fuel and way too much time on their hands and weirdly knightly aspirations.

Item.name: Crisis Hatchet
Item.description: A lightweight, one-handed axe with a prying head, for popping doors, hulls, and skulls alike.

Item.name: Hammerhunter Harpoon
Item.description: A huge, sharp, pronged harpoon designed for masochists who think that fighting a hammerhead with a harpoon is a good idea. It's far too large to be fired from a harpoon gun, but is instead meant to be thrust like a spear.

Item.name: Lunge Bomb
Item.description: A simple, yet extremely dangerous weapon- for both the user and the target. Essentially a long spear which has had it's head replaced with a modified 40mm grenade, which detonates via kinetic detonator when thrust forward quickly.

Item.name: Kitchen Knife
Item.description: A lightweight, cheap steel kitchen knife. It's an extremely common utensil for a variety of reasons, but it can double as a fairly decent stabbing weapon in a pinch, though it is very short.

Item.name: Makeshift Spear
Item.description: A huge, sharp, pronged harpoon designed for masochists who think that fighting a hammerhead with a harpoon is a good idea. It's far too large to be fired from a harpoon gun, but is instead meant to be thrust like a spear.
